summary: An email from Susan Shelling responding to a subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, stating she previously took a deposition in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County years earlier. She indicates any notes were destroyed after 5 years and she has no memory of the matter, suggesting the transcript should be available elsewhere.

persons.name: Susan Shelling
persons.context: Author of the email who states she took a deposition in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County several years ago and is now responding to a subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the case for which Susan Shelling received a subpoena, referenced in the email subject line.

connections.description: Shelling received a subpoena related to the Maxwell case, indicating she may have information relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Received by Susan Shelling
events.description: Susan Shelling received a subpoena related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case, prompting her to send this email response.

events.title: Deposition in Epstein Case
events.description: Susan Shelling took a deposition in the Jeffrey Epstein case in Palm Beach County, as referenced in her email.

keyFacts: Susan Shelling previously took a deposition in the Jeffrey Epstein case in Palm Beach County.
Shelling received a subpoena in September 2021 related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Shelling states that any notes she had from the Epstein deposition were destroyed as it was more than 5 years prior.
Shelling claims to have no memory of the Epstein deposition, suggesting the transcript should be available elsewhere.
The email indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case as of September 2021.
